text: Figeac () is a commune in southern France in the region of Occitanie. It is the sous-prefecture (capital) of the arrondissement of the same name in the Lot department. ==History== In the late ninth century, the King Pepin I of Aquitaine founded a monastery in Figeac; the town developed around the monastery as an important city on the pilgrimage routes. In the 14th century, the walls of Figeac were built. Figeac is on the via Podiensis, a major medieval pilgrimage trail which is part of the Way of St. James. ==Geography== Figeac is on the southwestern edge of the central plateau (Massif Central), north of the valley of the Lot river, on the right bank of the Célé river, a left tributary of the Lot. The commune has an area of and its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . Figeac and its neighboring communes Figeac is surrounded by the communesCamburat, Planioles, Viazac, Lunan, Capdenac, Faycelles, Béduer, Camboulit, Lissac-et-Mouret. ===Climate=== The climate of Figeac, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Figeac are known, in French, as Figeacois (women: Figeacoises). With a population of 9,820, Figeac has a population density of inhabitants/km2. This urban area is the centre of the metropolitan area of Figeac, formed by 33 communes with a population of 25,593 inhabitants and an area of . == Administration == Figeac is a subprefecture of the Lot department, the capital of the arrondissement of Figeac and the administrative centre () of the Figeac-1 and Figeac-2 cantons. It is part of the intercommunality Le Grand Figeac (). ==People from or related to Figeac== * Jean-François Champollion, the first translator of Egyptian hieroglyphs, was born in Figeac, where there is a Champollion Museum. On the "Place des écritures" ("Square of the Writings"), there is a giant copy of the Rosetta Stone, by Joseph Kosuth. * The actor Charles Boyer was also born in Figeac. ==Sister cities== Figeac is twinned with: * Roubaix, France * Carrara, Italy * Huesca, Spain ==Gallery== File:Place des ecritures Figeac.jpg|Place des écritures, Figeac File:Figeac Nt Dame Puy.jpg|Notre-Dame- du-Puy church File:Vue sur Figeac depuis le Cingle-Haut.jpg|View of Figeac from Cingle-Haut File:Église Saint-Thomas, Figeac.JPG|Saint-Thomas' Church ==Related pages== * Arrondissement of Figeac * Communes of the Lot department ==References== ==Other websites== * City Council website * Pays de Figeac tourist office Category:Subprefectures in France Category:Communes in Lot
